mdRecord.dcterms:title: New York, April 25, 1849: Dear Sir, You have probably ere this been made aware of the re-issue, aftr considerable delay, of the New Church Repository. : Circumstances of an untoward character, but which I could not control, have not only prevented its seasonable appearance but have also compelled me to assume, upon my own responsibility, the entire conduct and charge of the work in all its departments / Very respectfully, Yours, &c. Geo. Bush
Dear Sir You have probably ere this been made aware
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bush, George, 1796-1859
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Circular letter, printed on p. [1] only.
"P.S. Address the Editor, Geo. Bush, or publisher, Lewis C. Bush, 136 Nassau Street, New York. Terms: $3 per annum with the Diary: $2 without, payable in advance.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: From the Papers of the Joseph Carrington Cabell family, MSS 38-111.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: New Church repository
Periodicals--Publishing
